website_summaries.verdict: The CrossFit community has acknowledged the UA TriBase Reign 2 as one of the best trainers from Under Armour. Some even claim it to be a ‘Metcon Killer’ given how well it performs in various exercises.The second edition takes what people loved about the original version and makes it even better by upgrading the upper and the TriBase outsole. In short, it is a valid competitor in the CrossFit shoe arena.
pros: Many CrossFitters rave about the shoe’s versatility: it performs excellently across a wide range of activities, from weightlifting to HIIT
Most testers take note of the trainer’s sturdy and well-built construction
The upper of the TriBase Reign 2 is reported to conform well to the foot
The side rubber panels offer reliable protection for rope climbs, as stated in several reviews
A good number of users like that the Micro G midsole is flexible and responsive enough for short runs under 2 miles
More than a few wearers find the shoe comfortable enough for regular casual wear
cons: Those who prefer designs with a separated tongue may not like the shoe’s bootie style

customer_reviews.title: Nice cross trainer but they don’t fit a medium width foot comfortably
customer_reviews.text: Under Armour’s Tribase Reign 2.0 is a light weight good looking cross trainer. The length was true to size, but although they measure a medium width, they definitely run narrow. They were uncomfortably tight and I was forced to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: 5 Days a week and they could go 7!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes! Super comfortable out of the box. I feel like they have no break in time. They are great for leg day! The base of the shoe feels sturdy as a MF-er. If you weight lift and you want a shoe for just that. Buy this for yourself! UA is and has become the only brand I will represent just because of the quality!
customer_reviews.author: Corey-E

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and looks...but too tight
customer_reviews.text: I bought two color variations of this shoe and kept one hoping it will stretch out with some wear. These I returned since I still found the tightness to be a bit much (on the sides...the toe area had about .5" space). I would recommend buying these at your normal shoe size. Maybe going one half-size smaller may work, but if it doesn't, you could always exchange them for another size. Overall, a nice quality shoe but just a bit tight for my enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: CarTuned

customer_reviews.title: Great Comfortable Perfect Fit Shoe For Weight Training
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I put my pair on I was happy. Fit perfectly and super, super comfortable. The sole has perfect grip and these shoes are very stable when lifting. I was nervous about the bootie construction but would have nothing else now. Fits like a second skin. Great job on these Under Armour!
customer_reviews.author: wolff57

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but to tight
customer_reviews.text: I liked the shoe but Had to send back due to shoe being way to tight on width.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR WIDE FEET
customer_reviews.text: THESE ARE NARROW! SO NARROW. I TRIED TO MAKE THEM WORK, BUT AFTER 3 WEEKS OF SORE TOES DUE TO A SMALL TOE BOX, I SENT THEM BACK AND WENT BACK TO MY NIKE METCONS.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Another solid ua product
customer_reviews.text: The heel material was not nearly as stiff as I was hoping for. I wanted something more geared towards deadlifts and squats for the heel section of the shoe but over all a good trainer
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Ballard

customer_reviews.title: lace loops tore on second day
customer_reviews.text: First off, these seem like great shoes. However, only the second day of wearing them, went to lace up and both loops by the tongue on the right shoe, popped and tore. Pretty disappointed considering the price of these shoes. I know stuff like that happens, but usually not until there has been some actual wear. Be wary of shoddy stitch jobs!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Restvedt

customer_reviews.title: Solid trainer
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for the gym or any other fitness activity. Would not run with for more than a mile but a solid shoe. A little tight up in the toe box but nothing too bad. If you got wide feet this shoe is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shoe, I read the reviews and ordered it 1/2 size smaller than normal.
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Great Father’s Day Gift
customer_reviews.text: It was a father Day gift. He loved it! Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Happy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Previously worn sold as new
customer_reviews.text: I received a previously worn pair. The soles had pavement stains and the heal was scuffed.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Most comfy shoes
customer_reviews.text: This item fitted as expected!! Great packaging and delivered on time
customer_reviews.author: Arturo S.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, 30 days and no recourse. Lost $140
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware: lace stitching came out on day 30, no help from Amazon and under armor won't cover 3rd party sellers
customer_reviews.author: Justin Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color
customer_reviews.text: Ummm color totally not what was pictured. It was hot pink and bright blue. Like the fit of the but the color is off
customer_reviews.author: Liz L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect CrossFit shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great for any type of workout. Barbell, burpees, box jumps and short distance running.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Peery

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Don't waist your time and just buy them already great shoes !!!
customer_reviews.author: teggy bear

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great design and comfortable. Seems to be well made so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They look great, are super durable, and very comfortable. They are perfect for any type of workout from running, jumping, etc. I've worn cross trainers from other brands before, but these are the best by far!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: A little bit narrow, but great quality
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a great quality shoes, and your feet are "normal" you can't go wrong with this, great overall
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Skinny shoes for big people
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes. They are just too thin. I'm size 15, but I think there are standard/tiers of shoe width with these companies. Seems like it should be the foot width of someone at size 11-12 or something.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but definitely narrow
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, good performance. Fits my narrow foot like a glove so I can see others might struggle with that. Doesn't get a 5 star because it is so narrow it looks a bit dainty but otherwise a good looking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Gustavson

customer_reviews.title: Works great but color options are not for me:
customer_reviews.text: This would have been perfect if the band or "sock" like band on top of the foot wasn't so firm and rigid, and ultimately the color options are wak. Why, well because most of their gear do not have color pants/tops to match shoes appropriately. Sure, they perform well (4 stars) but if your about that colored life and looking like a clown, by all means pick any option. I just wish they considered having at least 2 neutral pairs (e.g., black/grey, or dark grey/light grey) for most color patterns sold in clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Great for WODs
customer_reviews.text: I hit my local box 5-6x times a week and these are prolly my favorite shoe. Much better than the Nike Metcon 5 or the Reebok Nano. Nike Metcons have a low toe to heel drop but lack the cushion for WODs with run. Reebook Nano 9s have good cushion for running but too much cushion for lifting. These are the perfect shoe right in between the two. One negative for some is the sock like lining in the shoe, it doesn’t bother me, but it may bother others. I wear a 12 in Reebok Nano 9 and a 12.5 in Nike metcons and I wear a 12 in these.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Diaz

product_meta.title: Under Armour TriBase Reign 2 Training Shoe
product_meta.description: Under Armour TriBase Reign 2 Training Shoes When you hit the gym, you need to feel as connected with the floor as possible. Every lift, rep and WOD starts from the ground up. Under Armour's TriBase technology maximises ground control with three points of contact for a low, stable base that allows natural foot flexibility. Well-constructed upper The TriBase Reign are another in a long-line of well constructed shoes from Under Armour, built using tough ripstop materials and a durable mesh for lightweight support these are the perfect gym shoe. An external heel counter has also been added for increased stability and heel lock-in helping keep your feet in place. This helps reduces the risk of injury in the gym and gives you a more comfortable and tailored fit for your feet. TriBase The outsole contains Under Armour's TriBase technology. This technology has been adapted to maximise ground contact where your foot needs it the most, allowing you to have superior upwards flexibility. This will promote natural motion and ensure downwards flexibility can grip to the ground during lifts. TriBase has been designed to ensure that when you lift, you have maximum support from your shoes and your feet giving you the solid base you need. The low to the ground construction adds to this, allowing you for greater feel and power transfer during dead-lifts. As power transfer is essential during lifts, Under Armour have constructed the shoes with a strategic rubber built under the toe box for an even more powerful floor grip making these the perfect shoes not just for lifting but for all those intense workouts. Cushioned Midsole and Durable Outsole A full-length Micro G foam midsole has been added for ultimate responsive cushioning, this ensures that the TriBase Reign give you the full support you need in the gym during any type of workout. A full-rubber outsole wraps up the lateral and medial sides of the feet providing you with maximum support all around your feet. Adding
feature_bullets: Tough Ripstop Material - All-around abrasion resistance.
TriBase - Maximising ground contact where the feet need it.
External Heel Counter - For increased stability.
Micro G foam midsole - For ultimate responsive cushioning.
